name: Emi Nakamura
bio: I create textiles and home decor inspired by Japanese minimalism and nature.
story: Each morning in Kyoto, I begin my day with a cup of tea and a walk through the garden. The textures, patterns, and calm energy of nature inspire every piece I create for ZenThreads. My work reflects Japanese minimalism—subtle, thoughtful, and balanced. Whether it’s a handwoven throw or a carefully dyed textile, I pour intention into each item. Creating a sense of peace for others through my craft is what I love most.

name: Lucas Steiner
bio: Handcrafted ceramics and accessories using Swiss clay and traditional methods.
story: Working with Swiss clay connects me to my roots. I grew up surrounded by nature in Bern, and now I bring that grounding energy into every bowl, planter, and accessory I shape. At Clay & Leaf, I focus on traditional methods, slow craftsmanship, and clean, organic designs. There's something satisfying about forming something raw into something useful—and beautiful.

name: Ravi Patel
bio: My creations celebrate Indian craftsmanship in modern wood decor.
story: Indian craftsmanship runs deep in my family. With WoodSpirit, I blend traditional wood carving techniques with modern aesthetics. Every design is personal—etched with cultural meaning and a contemporary twist. From my workshop in Jaipur, I shape stories into wood, bringing warmth and soul into homes around the world. It’s not just decor—it’s heritage.

name: Claire Dubois
bio: Jewelry with a rustic twist—crafted with natural and recycled materials.
story: In my little studio in Lyon, I give new life to forgotten materials. I find beauty in the rustic, the raw, the natural. Bijoux Nature is where I create jewelry that whispers stories of forests, rivers, and recycled treasures. Each pair of earrings or bracelet is made with love and a deep respect for nature. I like to think my pieces carry a quiet elegance, with a gentle reminder of where they came from.

name: Sofia Rossi
bio: Inspired by Tuscan landscapes, I create functional and decorative ceramics.
story: The rolling hills of Tuscany are more than my home—they're my muse. At Ceramica Viva, I craft ceramics that reflect the beauty of everyday life in Florence. Whether it’s a hand-painted vase or a rustic bowl, I aim to blend functionality with the warmth of Italian charm. I love knowing that something I made by hand becomes a part of someone’s home, their rituals, their memories.

name: Jake Collins
bio: Boho-inspired textiles and ceramic pieces crafted with heart and soul.
story: Boho is more than a style—it's a way of life. At Thread & Clay, I bring that laid-back, soulful vibe into every piece I make. Some days I’m weaving textiles; other days I’m shaping clay. What matters most is the feeling behind it: heart, soul, and creativity. From my studio in Toronto, I mix colors, textures, and a bit of wanderlust into everything I do.

name: Anita Kowalska
bio: Botanical art and cozy decor from the heart of Eastern Europe.
story: My inspiration grows from the forests and wildflowers of Eastern Europe. Nordic Bloom is where I turn that natural beauty into cozy decor and botanical art. Pressed flowers, soft throws, earthy tones—they all come from a deep love of the seasons and the stories they tell. I create with the intention of bringing a little comfort and nature into someone’s space.

name: Léa Moreau
bio: Colorful, unique handmade goods that bring joy to your space.
story: I’ve always believed that handmade things have a special kind of magic. From my sunny studio in Paris, I create colorful goods that spark joy—whether it’s a beaded necklace, a playful pouch, or a crochet hat. Crafts by Léa is all about celebrating creativity and individuality. Every piece I make is meant to brighten a day, tell a story, or make someone smile.

name: Akira Tanaka
bio: I explore natural textures and earthy tones in my ceramic and textile designs.
story: I find beauty in simplicity and texture—in the way clay feels in my hands or how natural dye takes to fabric. At Elemental Studio, I explore the earthy, the raw, and the imperfect. My work is quiet, humble, and deeply tied to nature. Creating with intention, honoring materials, and leaving space for stillness—that’s what drives me.

name: Isabella Garcia
bio: My art is a fusion of Mediterranean warmth and contemporary style.
story: SunClay Studio is where the warmth of the Mediterranean meets modern design. I love playing with shapes, light, and color to create ceramics that feel timeless but fresh. From Barcelona, I craft each piece by hand, inspired by the sun, the sea, and the stories we share over good food and good company. My hope is that my work brings a bit of that warmth into every home it touches.
